trans-unit.source: Move data from an on-premise SQL Server to SQL Azure with Azure Data Factory | Azure
trans-unit.target: Move data from an on-premise SQL Server to SQL Azure with Azure Data Factory | Azure

trans-unit.source: Set up an ADF pipeline that composes two data migration activities that together move data on a daily basis between databases on-premise and in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Set up an ADF pipeline that composes two data migration activities that together move data on a daily basis between databases on-premise and in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Move data from an on-premise SQL server to SQL Azure with Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data from an on-premise SQL server to SQL Azure with Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to move data from an on-premise SQL Server Database to a SQL Azure Database via Azure Blob Storage using the Azure Data Factory (ADF).
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to move data from an on-premise SQL Server Database to a SQL Azure Database via Azure Blob Storage using the Azure Data Factory (ADF).

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Introduction: What is ADF and when should it be used to migrate data?
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Introduction: What is ADF and when should it be used to migrate data?

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory is a fully managed cloud-based data integration service that orchestrates and automates the movement and transformation of data.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory is a fully managed cloud-based data integration service that orchestrates and automates the movement and transformation of data.

trans-unit.source: The key concept in the ADF model is pipeline.
trans-unit.target: The key concept in the ADF model is pipeline.

trans-unit.source: A pipelines is a logical groupings of Activities, each of which defines the actions to perform on the data contained in Datasets.
trans-unit.target: A pipelines is a logical groupings of Activities, each of which defines the actions to perform on the data contained in Datasets.

trans-unit.source: Linked services are used to define the information needed for Data Factory to connect to the data resources.
trans-unit.target: Linked services are used to define the information needed for Data Factory to connect to the data resources.

trans-unit.source: With ADF, existing data processing services can be composed into data pipelines that are highly available and managed in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: With ADF, existing data processing services can be composed into data pipelines that are highly available and managed in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: These data pipelines can be scheduled to ingest, prepare, transform, analyze, and publish data, and ADF will manage and orchestrate all of the complex data and processing dependencies.
trans-unit.target: These data pipelines can be scheduled to ingest, prepare, transform, analyze, and publish data, and ADF will manage and orchestrate all of the complex data and processing dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Solutions can be quickly built and deployed in the cloud, connecting a growing number of on-premises and cloud data sources.
trans-unit.target: Solutions can be quickly built and deployed in the cloud, connecting a growing number of on-premises and cloud data sources.

trans-unit.source: Consider using ADF when data needs to be continually migrated in a hybrid scenario that accesses both on-premise and cloud resources, and when the data is transacted or needs to be modified or have business logic added to it in the course of being migrated.
trans-unit.target: Consider using ADF when data needs to be continually migrated in a hybrid scenario that accesses both on-premise and cloud resources, and when the data is transacted or needs to be modified or have business logic added to it in the course of being migrated.

trans-unit.source: ADF allows for the scheduling and monitoring of jobs using simple JSON scripts that manage the movement of data on a periodic basis.
trans-unit.target: ADF allows for the scheduling and monitoring of jobs using simple JSON scripts that manage the movement of data on a periodic basis.

trans-unit.source: ADF also has other capabilities such as support for complex operations.
trans-unit.target: ADF also has other capabilities such as support for complex operations.

trans-unit.source: For more information on ADF, see the documentation at <link><linkText>Azure Data Factory (ADF)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on ADF, see the documentation at <link><linkText>Azure Data Factory (ADF)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>The Scenario
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>The Scenario

trans-unit.source: We set up an ADF pipeline that composes two data migration activities that together move data on a daily basis between an on-premise SQL database and an Azure SQL Database in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: We set up an ADF pipeline that composes two data migration activities that together move data on a daily basis between an on-premise SQL database and an Azure SQL Database in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: The two activities are:
trans-unit.target: The two activities are:

trans-unit.source: copy data from an on-premise SQL Server database to an Azure Blob Storage account
trans-unit.target: copy data from an on-premise SQL Server database to an Azure Blob Storage account

trans-unit.source: copy data from the Azure Blob Storage account to an Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: copy data from the Azure Blob Storage account to an Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Reference: The steps shown here have been adapted from the more detailed tutorial Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data provided by the ADF team and references to the relevant sections of that topic are provided when appropriate.
trans-unit.target: Reference: The steps shown here have been adapted from the more detailed tutorial Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data provided by the ADF team and references to the relevant sections of that topic are provided when appropriate.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have a subscription, you can sign up for a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have a subscription, you can sign up for a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: An Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: An Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: You will use an Azure storage account for storing the data in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will use an Azure storage account for storing the data in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure storage account, see the <link><linkText>Create a storage account</linkText><title></title></link> article.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure storage account, see the <link><linkText>Create a storage account</linkText><title></title></link> article.

trans-unit.source: After you have created the storage account, you will need to obtain the account key used to access the storage.
trans-unit.target: After you have created the storage account, you will need to obtain the account key used to access the storage.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>View, copy and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>View, copy and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Access to an Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Access to an Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: If you must setup an Azure SQL Database, <link><linkText>Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database </linkText><title></title></link> provides information on how to provision a new instance of a Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: If you must setup an Azure SQL Database, <link><linkText>Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database </linkText><title></title></link> provides information on how to provision a new instance of a Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Installed and configured Azure PowerShell locally.
trans-unit.target: Installed and configured Azure PowerShell locally.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This procedure uses the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This procedure uses the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Upload the data to your on-premise SQL Server
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Upload the data to your on-premise SQL Server

trans-unit.source: We use the <link><linkText>NYC Taxi dataset</linkText><title></title></link> to demonstrate the migration process.
trans-unit.target: We use the <link><linkText>NYC Taxi dataset</linkText><title></title></link> to demonstrate the migration process.

trans-unit.source: The NYC Taxi dataset is available, as noted that post, on Azure blob storage <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The NYC Taxi dataset is available, as noted that post, on Azure blob storage <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The data has two files, the trip_data.csv file which contains trip details and the trip_far.csv file which contains details of the fare paid for each trip.
trans-unit.target: The data has two files, the trip_data.csv file which contains trip details and the trip_far.csv file which contains details of the fare paid for each trip.

trans-unit.source: A sample and description of these files are provided in <link><linkText>NYC Taxi Trips Dataset Description</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A sample and description of these files are provided in <link><linkText>NYC Taxi Trips Dataset Description</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can either adapt the procedure provided here to a set of your own data or follow the steps as described by using the NYC Taxi dataset.
trans-unit.target: You can either adapt the procedure provided here to a set of your own data or follow the steps as described by using the NYC Taxi dataset.

trans-unit.source: To upload the NYC Taxi dataset into your on-premise SQL Server database, follow the procedure outlined in <link><linkText>Bulk Import Data into SQL Server Database</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To upload the NYC Taxi dataset into your on-premise SQL Server database, follow the procedure outlined in <link><linkText>Bulk Import Data into SQL Server Database</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: These instructions are for a SQL Server on an Azure Virtual Machine, but the procedure for uploading to the on-premise SQL Server is the same.
trans-unit.target: These instructions are for a SQL Server on an Azure Virtual Machine, but the procedure for uploading to the on-premise SQL Server is the same.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Create an Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Create an Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: The instructions for creating a new Azure Data Factory and a resource group in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> are provided <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The instructions for creating a new Azure Data Factory and a resource group in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> are provided <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Name the new ADF instance adfdsp and name the resource group created adfdsprg.
trans-unit.target: Name the new ADF instance adfdsp and name the resource group created adfdsprg.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure up the Data Management Gateway
trans-unit.target: Install and configure up the Data Management Gateway

trans-unit.source: To enable your pipelines in an Azure data factory to work with an on-premise SQL Server, you need to add it as a linked service to the data factory.
trans-unit.target: To enable your pipelines in an Azure data factory to work with an on-premise SQL Server, you need to add it as a linked service to the data factory.

trans-unit.source: To create a Linked Service for the on-premise SQL Server, you must first download and install Microsoft Data Management Gateway onto the on-premise computer and configure the linked service for the on-premises data source to use the gateway.
trans-unit.target: To create a Linked Service for the on-premise SQL Server, you must first download and install Microsoft Data Management Gateway onto the on-premise computer and configure the linked service for the on-premises data source to use the gateway.

trans-unit.source: The Data Management Gateway serializes and deserializes the source and sink data on the computer where it is hosted.
trans-unit.target: The Data Management Gateway serializes and deserializes the source and sink data on the computer where it is hosted.

trans-unit.source: For set-up instructions and details on Data Management Gateway, see <link><linkText>Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For set-up instructions and details on Data Management Gateway, see <link><linkText>Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create linked services to connect to the data resources
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create linked services to connect to the data resources

trans-unit.source: A linked service defines the information needed for Azure Data Factory to connect to a data resource.
trans-unit.target: A linked service defines the information needed for Azure Data Factory to connect to a data resource.

trans-unit.source: The step-by-step procedure for creating linked services is provided in <link><linkText>Create linked services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The step-by-step procedure for creating linked services is provided in <link><linkText>Create linked services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: We have three resources in this scenario for which linked services are needed.
trans-unit.target: We have three resources in this scenario for which linked services are needed.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Linked service for on-premise SQL Server</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Linked service for on-premise SQL Server</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Linked service for Azure Blob Storage</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Linked service for Azure Blob Storage</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Linked service for Azure SQL database</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Linked service for Azure SQL database</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Linked service for on-premise SQL Server database
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Linked service for on-premise SQL Server database

trans-unit.source: To create the linked service for the on-premise SQL Server, click on the Data Store in the ADF landing page on Azure Portal, select SQL and enter the credentials for the username and password for the on-premise SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: To create the linked service for the on-premise SQL Server, click on the Data Store in the ADF landing page on Azure Portal, select SQL and enter the credentials for the username and password for the on-premise SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: You need to enter the servername as a fully qualified servername backslash instance name (servername\instancename).
trans-unit.target: You need to enter the servername as a fully qualified servername backslash instance name (servername\instancename).

trans-unit.source: Name the linked service adfonpremsql.
trans-unit.target: Name the linked service adfonpremsql.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Linked service for Blob
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Linked service for Blob

trans-unit.source: To create the linked service for the Azure Blob Storage account, click on the Data Store in the ADF landing page on Azure Portal, select Azure Storage Account and enter the Azure Blob Storage account key and container name.
trans-unit.target: To create the linked service for the Azure Blob Storage account, click on the Data Store in the ADF landing page on Azure Portal, select Azure Storage Account and enter the Azure Blob Storage account key and container name.

trans-unit.source: Name the link service adfds.
trans-unit.target: Name the link service adfds.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Linked service for Azure SQL database
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Linked service for Azure SQL database

trans-unit.source: To create the linked service for the Azure SQL Database, click on the Data Store in the ADF landing page on Azure Portal, select Azure SQL and enter the credentials for the username and password for the Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: To create the linked service for the Azure SQL Database, click on the Data Store in the ADF landing page on Azure Portal, select Azure SQL and enter the credentials for the username and password for the Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: The username must be specified as user@servername.
trans-unit.target: The username must be specified as user@servername.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Define and create tables to specify how to access the datasets
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Define and create tables to specify how to access the datasets

trans-unit.source: Create tables that specify the structure, location and availability of the datasets with the following script-based procedures.
trans-unit.target: Create tables that specify the structure, location and availability of the datasets with the following script-based procedures.

trans-unit.source: JSON files are used to define the tables.
trans-unit.target: JSON files are used to define the tables.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the structure of these files, see <link><linkText>Datasets</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the structure of these files, see <link><linkText>Datasets</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You should execute Switch-AzureMode -Name AzureResourceManager and the Add-AzureAccount cmdlets prior to executing the New-AzureDataFactoryTable cmdlet to confirm that the Azure PowerShell cmdlets are available and that the right Azure subscription is selected for the command execution.
trans-unit.target: You should execute Switch-AzureMode -Name AzureResourceManager and the Add-AzureAccount cmdlets prior to executing the New-AzureDataFactoryTable cmdlet to confirm that the Azure PowerShell cmdlets are available and that the right Azure subscription is selected for the command execution.

trans-unit.source: For documentation of these cmdlets, see <link><linkText>Switch-AzureMode</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Add-AzureAccoun</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For documentation of these cmdlets, see <link><linkText>Switch-AzureMode</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Add-AzureAccoun</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The JSON-based definitions in the tables use the following names:
trans-unit.target: The JSON-based definitions in the tables use the following names:

trans-unit.source: the table name in the on-premise SQL server is nyctaxi_data
trans-unit.target: the table name in the on-premise SQL server is nyctaxi_data

trans-unit.source: the container name in the Azure Blob Storage account is containername
trans-unit.target: the container name in the Azure Blob Storage account is containername

trans-unit.source: Three table definitions are needed for this ADF pipeline:
trans-unit.target: Three table definitions are needed for this ADF pipeline:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>SQL on-premise Table</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>SQL on-premise Table</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Blob Table </linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Blob Table </linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>SQL Azure Table</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>SQL Azure Table</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The following procedures use Azure PowerShell to define and create the ADF activities.
trans-unit.target: The following procedures use Azure PowerShell to define and create the ADF activities.

trans-unit.source: But these tasks can also be accomplished using the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: But these tasks can also be accomplished using the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Create input and output datasets</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Create input and output datasets</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>SQL on-premise Table
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>SQL on-premise Table

trans-unit.source: The table definition for the on-premise SQL Server is specified in the following JSON file.
trans-unit.target: The table definition for the on-premise SQL Server is specified in the following JSON file.

trans-unit.source: Note that the column names were not included here, you can sub-select on the column names by including them here (for details please check the <link><linkText>ADF documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Note that the column names were not included here, you can sub-select on the column names by including them here (for details please check the <link><linkText>ADF documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Copy the JSON definition of the table into a file called onpremtabledef.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\onpremtabledef.json).
trans-unit.target: Copy the JSON definition of the table into a file called onpremtabledef.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\onpremtabledef.json).

trans-unit.source: Create the table in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Create the table in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Blob Table
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Blob Table

trans-unit.source: Definition for the table for the output blob location is in the following (this maps the ingested data from on-premise to Azure blob):
trans-unit.target: Definition for the table for the output blob location is in the following (this maps the ingested data from on-premise to Azure blob):

trans-unit.source: Copy the JSON definition of the table into a file called bloboutputtabledef.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\bloboutputtabledef.json).
trans-unit.target: Copy the JSON definition of the table into a file called bloboutputtabledef.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\bloboutputtabledef.json).

trans-unit.source: Create the table in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Create the table in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>SQL Azure Table
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>SQL Azure Table

trans-unit.source: Definition for the table for the SQL Azure output is in the following (this schema maps the data coming from the blob):
trans-unit.target: Definition for the table for the SQL Azure output is in the following (this schema maps the data coming from the blob):

trans-unit.source: Copy the JSON definition of the table into a file called AzureSqlTable.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\AzureSqlTable.json).
trans-unit.target: Copy the JSON definition of the table into a file called AzureSqlTable.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\AzureSqlTable.json).

trans-unit.source: Create the table in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Create the table in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Define and create the pipeline
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Define and create the pipeline

trans-unit.source: Specify the activities that belong to the pipeline and create the pipeline with the following script-based procedures.
trans-unit.target: Specify the activities that belong to the pipeline and create the pipeline with the following script-based procedures.

trans-unit.source: A JSON file is used to define the pipeline properties.
trans-unit.target: A JSON file is used to define the pipeline properties.

trans-unit.source: The script assumes that the pipeline name is AMLDSProcessPipeline.
trans-unit.target: The script assumes that the pipeline name is AMLDSProcessPipeline.

trans-unit.source: Also note that we set the periodicity of the pipeline to be executed on daily basis and use the default execution time for the job (12 am UTC).
trans-unit.target: Also note that we set the periodicity of the pipeline to be executed on daily basis and use the default execution time for the job (12 am UTC).

trans-unit.source: The following procedures use Azure PowerShell to define and create the ADF pipeline.
trans-unit.target: The following procedures use Azure PowerShell to define and create the ADF pipeline.

trans-unit.source: But this task can also be accomplished using the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: But this task can also be accomplished using the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Create and run a pipeline</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Create and run a pipeline</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Using the table definitions provided above, the pipeline definition for the ADF is specified as follows:
trans-unit.target: Using the table definitions provided above, the pipeline definition for the ADF is specified as follows:

trans-unit.source: Copy this JSON definition of the pipeline into a file called pipelinedef.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\pipelinedef.json).
trans-unit.target: Copy this JSON definition of the pipeline into a file called pipelinedef.json file and save it to a known location (here assumed to be C:\temp\pipelinedef.json).

trans-unit.source: Create the pipeline in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Create the pipeline in ADF with the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you can see the pipeline on the ADF in the Azure portal show up as following (when you click on the diagram)
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you can see the pipeline on the ADF in the Azure portal show up as following (when you click on the diagram)

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Start the Pipeline
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Start the Pipeline

trans-unit.source: The pipeline can now be run using the following command:
trans-unit.target: The pipeline can now be run using the following command:

trans-unit.source: The startdate and enddate parameter values need to be replaced with the actual dates between which you want the pipeline to run.
trans-unit.target: The startdate and enddate parameter values need to be replaced with the actual dates between which you want the pipeline to run.

trans-unit.source: Once the pipeline executes, you should be able to see the data show up in the container selected for the blob, one file per day.
trans-unit.target: Once the pipeline executes, you should be able to see the data show up in the container selected for the blob, one file per day.

trans-unit.source: Note that we have not leveraged the functionality provided by ADF to pipe data incrementally.
trans-unit.target: Note that we have not leveraged the functionality provided by ADF to pipe data incrementally.

trans-unit.source: For more details on how to do this and other capabilities provided by ADF, see the <link><linkText>ADF documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details on how to do this and other capabilities provided by ADF, see the <link><linkText>ADF documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
